description:
T1. Cedar 	Front gardens 	Very large mature prominent tree. Climbing inspection and visual tree inspection have recommended for the south east proportion of the canopy to be reduced to alleviate loading on the leaning side of the tree. 

Tip reduce south east lateral spread of canopy over road by 3m to growth points, balancing form and paying attention to aesthetics. Reduce back overlong lateral and low lateral branches by 1-2m  throughout remainder of canopy to mitigate limb failures.
CH 20m PH 20 
CS 20m PS 17m   

Pruning works to be carried out from cherry picker.
decision_conditions:
While a report was submitted in support of the proposed works, it does not constitute a full or conclusive tree assessment, as the proposed works are not sufficiently substantiated to justify intervention. 

Although the tree exhibits a lean and canopy bias toward the south-east, no evidence has been provided to demonstrate whether the lean is natural, or if there are any structural defects, decay, or imminent risk of failure. The tree appears to be in good physiological condition.

The species in question, a mature cedar, is known to be sensitive to pruning. The proposed 3m tip reduction and 1–2m all-round canopy reduction are considered excessive and likely to negatively impact the tree’s form, health, and amenity value. The works appear to be precautionary rather than necessary for the tree’s health or safety, and no alternative mitigation measures (e.g., selective pruning or bracing) have been explored.
